title: Sara Gran- Claire DeWitt and the City of the Dead.pdf
description:
I searched high and low for this. The format isn't pretty, but it is literally the only ebook of the City of the Dead that I could find. And it started out as a .lit file, so that certainly didn't help. Despite the aesthetic flaws, though, the book is complete and- unlike the spamming links that litter Google search- entirely readable. 

Here's the summary:

Claire DeWitt is not your average private investigator. She has brilliant deductive skills and is an ace at discovering evidence. But Claire also uses her dreams, omens, and mind-expanding herbs to help her solve mysteries, and relies on DÃƒÂ©tection Ã¢â‚¬â€ the only book published by the late, great, and mysterious French detective Jacques Silette.

The tattooed, pot-smoking Claire has just arrived in post-Katrina New Orleans, the city sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s avoided since her mentor, SiletteÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s student Constance Darling, was murdered there. Claire is investigating the disappearance of Vic Willing, a prosecutor known for winning convictions in a homicide- plagued city. Has an angry criminal enacted revenge on Vic? Or did he use the storm as a means to disappear? Claire follows the clues, finding old friends and making new enemiesÃ¢â‚¬â€foremost among them Andray Fairview, a young gang member who just might hold the key to the mystery.

Littered with memories of ClaireÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s years as a girl detective in 1980s Brooklyn, Claire DeWitt and the City of the Dead is a knockout start to a bracingly original new series.
